channel.title: Dr. Bogdan Radu on Bogdan Radu
channel.description: Recent content in Dr. Bogdan Radu on Bogdan Radu

item.description: Maxwell stress tensor derivation Notation Let $\widehat\Omega\subseteq\mathbb{R}^3$ be a reference domain comprised of points denoted by $\widehat{x}\in\widehat{\Omega}$. Further, we define a placement mapping $\widehat{p}:\mathbb{R}^+\times \widehat{\Omega}\to \mathbb{R}^3$, $x:=x(s):= \widehat{p}(s,\widehat{x})$ and a sequence of domains $$\begin{aligned} \Omega(s) = {x = \widehat{p}(s,\widehat{x}), \forall,\widehat{x}\in\widehat{\Omega}}\end{aligned}$$ We choose $\widehat{p}$ such that $\Omega(0)=\widehat{\Omega}$, i.e. $\widehat{x}= \widehat{p}(0,\widehat{x})$. The inverse of $\widehat{p}$ we denote by $p^{-1}:\mathbb{R}\times \Omega(s)\to \widehat{\Omega}$ via $\widehat{x}= p^{-1}(s,x)$. We also write $\widehat{F}(s,\widehat{x}) = \widehat D_{\widehat{x}}\widehat{p}(s,\widehat{x})$ for the jacobian of $\widehat{p}$, aka the deformation gradient, as well as $\widehat{J}(s,\widehat{x}) = \det \widehat{F}(s,\widehat{x})$ for the functional determinant.

item.title: Dr. Bogdan Radu
item.description: About Me I am a PostDoc at the Radon institute for computational and applied mathematics (RICAM) in Linz, Austria. I received my PhD in applied mathematics from TU Darmstadt on “Finite element mass lumping for H(div) and H(curl)" under the supervision of Prof. Dr. Herbert Egger. Research Interest I am an expert in finite element methods with mass lumping, where one seeks to replace the mass matrix $M$ by a suitable (block)diagonal approximation $M_h$ in the context of wave propagation problems.
